bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Information and Complaint
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Insert full name, residence and occupation of informant or complainant

THE INFORMATION AND COMPLAINT OF Thomas Walter Chard of Regina, in the Province of Saskatchewan, taken this 14th day of June in the year 1921, before the undersigned A. J. G. MacEchen one of His Majesty's Justices of the Peace in and for the said Province, who saith that Fletcher Decker formerly of near Wiwa Hill of x Post Office, in on the or about the 15th day of November A.D. 1915 at near Wiwa Hill Post Office, aforesaid, in the said Province did steal about Three Hundred (300) buschels of flax the property of Claude Ficklin and was thereby guilty of theft.
Insert full name, residence and occupation of person accused with particulars of offence charged giving place and date
SWORN before me the day and year first above mentioned, at Regina in the said Province.
A Justice of the Peace in and for the Province of Saskatchewan.
I hereby certify that the within Information and Complaint is a true copy of the original Information and Complaint in this matter.
